contents.item: So, have a little fun. Soon enough you'll be dead and burning in Hell with the rest of your family.
Dead. Never been that before. Not even once.
And in what fairy tale would John ever be any sane person's idea of Prince Charming anyway? He was the opposite of charming. More like Prince Terrifying.
As for Gussie Finknottle, many an experienced undertaker would have been deceived by his appearance and started embalming on sight.
Death doesn't care about personalities - he's more interested in meeting quotas.
Did you get notes for me?""No", Ronan replied,"I thought you were dead in a ditch.
You only live twice:Once when you are bornAnd once when you look death in the face
contents.owner: Ian Fleming, You Only Live Twice

contents.item: You were born a child of light’s wonderful secret— you return to the beauty you have always been.
contents.owner: Aberjhani, Visions of a Skylark Dressed in Black

contents.item: To study philosophy is nothing but to prepare one’s self to die.
Don't fear the gods,Don't worry about death;What is good is easy to get, andWhat is terrible is easy to endure.
contents.owner: Epicurus, The Epicurus Reader: Selected Writings and Testimonia

contents.item: Neither the sun nor death can be looked at steadily.
Life is a bitter sweet journey my friend, a bitter sweet journey.
Because each of you has his or her own death, you carry it with you in a secret place from the moment you're born, it belongs to you and you belong to it.
To pursue wisdom is to live in such a way that one is prepared to face death when it comes. (247)
contents.owner: Gregory Bassham, The Ultimate Harry Potter and Philosophy: Hogwarts for Muggles

contents.item: You were free, you are free and you will be free.

When we die, as when the scenes have been fixed on to celluloid and the scenery is pulled down and burnt — we are phantoms in the memories of our descendants. Then we are ghosts, my dear, then we are myths. But still we are together. We are the past together, we are a distant past. Beneath the dome of the mysterious stars, I still hear your voice.

Love taught me to die with dignity that I might come forth anew in splendor. Born once of flesh, then again of fire, I was reborn a third time to the sound of my name humming haikus in heaven’s mouth.
contents.owner: Aberjhani, The River of Winged Dreams

contents.item: We love ourselves notwithstanding our faults, and we ought to love our friends in like manner.
The awful thing is that if i can forget they're people, it will be no different at all
Vivo sin vivir en mí... muero porque no muero. (I live without really being alive... I die because I am not dying.)
